Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Bryan_Beus nice docs!

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c do you think KMD will do something like this? or I have heard you mention some kind of automated way to convert: https://zcash.readthedocs.io/en/latest/rtd_pages/sapling_turnstile.html

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we do need to do this process, but for PIRATE I wanted a fully automated process and once that exists, other sapling chains can do the same

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c i think allowing users too much freedom in this process might actually not be good, just give everybody a big easy *upgrade* button that moves all funds to sapling addresses seems better

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: having to decide how many transactions to use to move your funds ... like in the docs .. almost no user wants to deal with that

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, on launch it would just start migrating funds until it is all done

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I am a notary node operator and I don't even want to deal with that, I just want to migrate everything to sapling

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: having both kinds of addresses in 1 wallet sounds like a nightmare

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: very excited for JoinSplits to happen in a few seconds, with 97% less RAM. That changes everything

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Deleted User inefficient math vs. efficient math

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is always easier to make an inefficient solution than an efficient one

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why would anything else be expected?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Deleted User they always planned to have a sequence of better algorithms, that is why you see all these Jack In The Bean Stalk  codenames (MagicBean, Sprout, Sapling)

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: there is some very dense math that I could barely get thru, but from what I understand, they had to use a very inefficient algorithm before, to make sure they used a verifiably secure algo or something like that. Then they changed internals to be more efficient, and then more efficient algos can be used for zkSnarks proofs

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the internal math stuff of Sapling is totally different from Sprout. From the outside, it's not very noticeable, it's mostly abstracted away

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: some of this speedup is from things being re-implemented in Rust

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://github.com/zcash/zcash/issues/2465

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: you can see there, Groth16 is the new system, it uses different elliptic curves and all kinds of things

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: Made two dumb scripts to upload and download gpg encrypted data using KV to Coqui Cash (or any kmd chain) https://github.com/chainmakers/chainmaker/tree/master/data

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: `setgenerate true 0` means the node is in staking mode for PoS % chains

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: thanks @blackjok3r

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: You cannot PoW mine and stake onthe same node

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: if the chain is dual PoS/PoW you need mimimum of 2 nodes to  keep it moving

Author: ulhaq.anwaar#2918
Content:
I am testing a Blockchain which is 100% POS I am trying to run two nodes. The first node -gen -genproclimit=0 but on the second node the genproclimit=256 
Does It mean that after 256 no more transactions will work?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: no proc limit is hpw many cores you want to use 256 is a bit high 😂

Author: ulhaq.anwaar#2918
Content: In order to keep the Blockchain validating and transactions to go on what can I do in 100% POS so that it never stops. Please note I'm using 2 Nodes only

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: try with =1 😉

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: to make sure PoS keeps going use more than 2 nodes, and make sure the coins are in 64 segids

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: https://github.com/StakedChain/pos64splitter

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: is the easiest way to acheive this

Author: ulhaq.anwaar#2918
Content: lol so the proc limit is cpu limit sorry my bad

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Currently after a certain amount of time, you would need to merge all those address and all mined blocks back to a single address and then resplit... its not a simple as just starrting the chain and leave it and it will keep working. For staked one of the things on my list is modifying my block notify script to automatically manage utxo's without all my extra functions added to simplfy it... Those will be avalibe for anyone once finished.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: There are better ways to stake than just having more coins than someone else...

Author: ulhaq.anwaar#2918
Content: So what If I keep the -ac_staked=90 so will that prevent it from happening?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: No if its staked any percent... there has to be a working staking node, or the chain wil stop

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The advantage of staked chains % of any amount far out weigh the extra time it takes to learn how to manage it

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: You cannot mining attack a PoS % chain with nicehash, the difficulty will rise so fast on the PoW side they will just waste all their money

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Chain stalls of a long time cannot happen.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: provided you have proper staking nodes running

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: on staked we will probably use even 1% PoS on PoW chains for this reason.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the chain wont stop

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: blocks might take 5 to 10 minutes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not sure why you would have to merge all addresses

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: granted if you have all funds in a single address in a single utxo, it might take 2 hours for each block

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but with any sort of normal coin distribution, the longest a block would take would be 10 minutes or so, this is because the concept of time is accelerated after 5 minutes of no blocks. after 10 minutes it is like a day has passed. after 15 minutes, like 4 days

Author: Alright#0419
Content: don't need to merge all of them if staking node has pubkey set

Author: Alright#0419
Content: just need to merge all the mining rewards

Content: why do the mining rewards need to be merged?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: well I'm pretty sure he's talking about something similar to what I did on MGNX

Author: Alright#0419
Content: is *very* messed up with 35k UTXOs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: oh, ok having that many utxo would only happen if you are getting most of the blocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: certainly the big whale will need to maintain the wallet

Author: ulhaq.anwaar#2918
Content:
Actually my pubkey is set for 100% POS.  What I do is I create the first node with no -gen flag then I got it's pubkey and in the second node I had -gen with -pubkey=FROM_THE_FIRST_NODE 
Now all the Stack is on the first node including premined and staking coins

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes thats what I was talking about ... this guy said he wanted ONLY 2 nodes... which means 1 wallet is getting ALL of the blocks

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: in that case after some time has passed it will stop staking

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: due to twallet explosion

Author: ulhaq.anwaar#2918
Content: Yeah that's exactly what's hapening

Author: ulhaq.anwaar#2918
Content: On block 101 no more transctions

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: No Im talking abput after 50, 000 blocks lol

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you probably didnt set the staking utxo early enough ... might have to start agian, they are tricky to start

Author: ulhaq.anwaar#2918
Content: What's the logic behind first 100 blocks?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: 100 blocks is coinbase maturity depth

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: which means it takes 100 blocks for a mined coin to mature, to be usable

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: block 1 does not mature until block 101

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Bryan_Beus `getblockchaininfo` now returns a new `size_on_disk` key, which is the size of the blockchain, on disk, in bytes

Author: ulhaq.anwaar#2918
Content: @dukeleto  thank you so much

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content:
@Bryan_Beus ```$ ./komodo-cli getblockchaininfo|grep size_on_disk
  "size_on_disk": 5054396460,```

Content: @dukeleto I think block maturity on all assetchains is 1

Content: I believe the reason for it being 100 is that the POS % is calculated based on the last 100 blocks

Content: ah, I didn't know that for PoS chains
